title: [Self-Directed] Traffic Accident Severity Prediction Modeling Project

context.prior_knowledge: Basic statistics, linear algebra, and fundamental machine learning concepts
context.additional_context: Multi-task deep learning model development utilizing real traffic accident data and interpretability analysis

learning_goals: Design a system classifying traffic accident severity (casualty/property damage) into three levels using a multi-task deep learning model

Learners will visualize CNN-based image classification predictions for ≥3 samples using LRP (Layer-wise Relevance Propagation), identify and interpret the top 3 feature regions per class based on generated heatmaps.

Learners will apply ≥3 preprocessing techniques (missing value handling, normalization, encoding) to a dataset using Python, build two classification/regression models with Scikit-learn or TensorFlow/Keras, and evaluate performance using ≥4 metrics (accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
